close_symbols: lfs_mdir (structure) and nested m fields: count, split, pair
lfs_t (structure) and fields: name_max, mlist, gstate
LFS_MKTAG / LFS_MKTAG_IF / LFS_MKATTRS (macros used to form attributes)
explanation: To determine whether any controlling expression in lfs_rename_ is invariant (a MISRA C concern), the analyzer must know which tests can produce differing results at runtime versus which are compile‑time/constants. The listed symbols are exactly the functions, data fields, macros and constants that appear in or directly determine the outcome of the function's controlling expressions: - Functions that produce values used in conditions (lfs_fs_forceconsistency, lfs_dir_find, lfs_tag_id, lfs_path_islast, lfs_pair_cmp, lfs_path_isdir, lfs_tag_type3, lfs_path_namelen, lfs_dir_get, lfs_dir_fetch, lfs_fs_preporphans, lfs_fs_prepmove, lfs_dir_commit, lfs_gstate_hasmove, lfs_gstate_hasorphans, lfs_fs_pred, lfs_dir_drop). Knowing their semantics/possible return values is required to determine if the corresponding if/conditional expressions can vary. - Data structures and fields accessed by conditionals (lfs_t.name_max, lfs_t.mlist, lfs_t.gstate, and the lfs_mdir structure with m.count, m.split, m.pair). These affect comparisons like nlen > lfs->name_max and prevdir.m.count > 0. - Helper that mutates/read data used by conditions (lfs_pair_fromle32) because it transforms data (prevpair) that flows into lfs_dir_fetch and thus into subsequent conditions. - Constants/macros used in comparisons (LFS_ERR_NOENT, LFS_ERR_INVAL, LFS_ERR_NOTDIR, LFS_ERR_NAMETOOLONG, LFS_ERR_ISDIR, LFS_TYPE_DIR, magic id 0x3ff) so that equality/inequality tests can be interpreted. - Attribute/tag macros (LFS_MKTAG / LFS_MKTAG_IF / LFS_MKATTRS) influence the logic of lfs_dir_commit calls and the effect of prior conditionals; their semantics can affect whether sequences of operations are effectively invariant. Without knowledge of these symbols (their definitions/semantics and whether their results depend on runtime state), one cannot soundly decide if any controlling expression in lfs_rename_ is an invariant (compile‑time or otherwise), or if it legitimately varies at runtime. The next analyzer should load the definitions/implementations or documented semantics of these symbols to conclude compliance with MISRA rule "Controlling expressions shall not be invariant".
